bboxes.raw_text:
PHILADEL PHIA Ernest
Evans, better known as Chubby
Checker. married a Dutch beauty
contest winner at an all white
Lutheran church in Pennsauken,
NJ.


Chubby and his bride, the for
mer Catherine Lodders, received
the blessings Of his mother, Mrs.
Raymond Evans, who had been
upset over the interracial mar
riage.


Three weeks before his mother
had asked for prayers to keep
him from marrying THAT GIRL"


The couple will live at the
palatial home Chubby purchased
for his parents last year.


More than ESQ guests attended
the reception and an estimated
1000 persons stood outside.
Many shouts against the marriage
we're heard.

HOSPITAL TRANSFERRED Reverend William j. Harvey ght)
of the Foreign Mission Board Of the National Baptist
Convention, USA Inc. and William H. Huff
era National Public Health Service Of Liberia, document
transferring the Carrie " Dyer Memorial Hospital Monroa
the Liberian Government Witnessing transfer rom Left
j. Dossen Richards Attorney General Dr. j. B. Falconer
supervisor West African Missions, and DR.. F. S. Scarborough
advisor, National Public Health Service.


The hospital, specializing in maternity and child
started in 1923 the Baptist Hospital by the Foreign Mission
Board.


Transfer will permit the board extend Its medical program
provinces Of Liberia Reverend Harvey sad 1--WE will
be able to further medical the Suehn Mission


larger community maternity and child welfare cinc the Bendoo
Mission clinic with for inpaens who must be trans
Government Hospital Bible Industrial Academy
clinic with special community visiting service and ay Mission
chidren's center where intensive care Is given"


The hospital renamed Carrie " Maternity Center
$780, after the late Carrie " Dyer who her
the hospital.


The hospital reorganzed in le45 and coordnaed with Ii
beria's national health program.


Disaster Struck In 1853 when the building of the hospital
destroyed by fire. until 1856 that the hospital
opened with increased facilities.

Mr.. and Mrs. Otto Whitfield,
Sr., announce the engagement
of their daughter, Beverly and
Louis J.. Francis.


Mr.. Francis is the son of Mrs.
Gertrude Francis of Beaumont,
Texas. He recently completed
duty as a second machinist mate
with the u. S. Navy in Japan.

The annual fashion show and
revue of special classes of the
Mckinley will be held April %
at 8 pm.


The program will be held at
the OFT School, 1901 S. 18th
Street. There is no charge.


This years theme is Tulip
Time in Holland"

furnished. $40 per week near
